title: How to Make a Meat and Vegetable Fried Rice

steps.headline: Prepare the vegetables.
steps.description: Rinse everything before cutting. Dice the onion and cut the carrots length-wise (the size of the pieces will be up to you). Cut any other vegetables you want to use. Place the vegetables in a bowl.

steps.headline: Cut the meat into good or bite sized pieces.
steps.description: Place the cut meat pieces into another bowl.

steps.headline: Cover a pan or wok with cooking spray or add about a tablespoon of vegetable oil.
steps.description: Heat it on a medium to high heat.

steps.headline: Cook the meat.
steps.description: Stir them around in the pan until they are brown in color.

steps.headline: Add and sauté the vegetables for about 4 minutes or until tender.
Add the rice to the pan.
steps.description: If the rice is refrigerated, try to break it up with your spatula.

steps.headline: Add a few shakes of sauce and stir everything together.
Turn the heat on low and let everything heat through.

text: Prepare the vegetables. Rinse everything before cutting. Dice the onion and cut the carrots length-wise (the size of the pieces will be up to you). Cut any other vegetables you want to use. Place the vegetables in a bowl. Cut the meat into good or bite sized pieces. Place the cut meat pieces into another bowl. Cover a pan or wok with cooking spray or add about a tablespoon of vegetable oil. Heat it on a medium to high heat. Cook the meat. Stir them around in the pan until they are brown in color. Add and sauté the vegetables for about 4 minutes or until tender.  Add the rice to the pan. If the rice is refrigerated, try to break it up with your spatula. Add a few shakes of sauce and stir everything together.  Turn the heat on low and let everything heat through.  Finished.
